title: Comments on the Resolution Framework for Banks and Bank Holding Companies in the United States
content: - 7 -   probability of failure by reducing its short-term creditors’ incentives to run at the first   sign of distress.   In short, we and other U.S. regulators are working hard to address the too-big-to-  fail problem by improving the prospects for the orderly resolution of a GSIB in the   United States.  The Dodd-Frank Act gave us tools to reduce the probability of failure of   our largest and most complex banking firms and to significantly reduce the damage that   the failure of such a firm would do to the U.S. financial system and the broader economy.    We have made a lot of progress toward accomplishing these goals, leaving the U.S.   banking system fundamentally safer and stronger, and our work in this area will continue.   Thank you.
